intro: Iphigenia oliveri, commonly known as the Oliver's iphigenia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, violet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Iphigenia oliveri is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its island habitat.
